content.text: Charlotte Panna is the 28th daughter and 61st child of the Charlotte Family and an officer of the Big Mom Pirates. She was a member of Charlotte Oven's army to ambush Monkey D. Luffy on Cacao Island.

Panna is a tall young woman with long, light-colored hair. She has large, round eyes, long eyelashes, and predominant, round ears. She has long arms and legs. She wears a dark-colored dress with a prominent high collar, a crescent pattern on it, a light-colored scarf, and a light-colored belt. She has a large bow on her back, and she wears large mammalian gloves. She also wears dark-colored boots.
Panna appears to be loyal to her family and crew, as shown when she answered Oven's call to gather on Cacao Island to ambush Luffy.
As an officer of the Big Mom Pirates, Panna has authority over lower-ranking members of her crew. She is strong enough to have been sent with many of her siblings to Cacao Island to fight Luffy.
Panna's abilities are unknown, as she has never been shown fighting. However, as a member of Oven's army, she is likely quite strong.
Panna wears large, mammalian gloves, each of which has three sharp claw-like knives attached. It is assumed that Panna uses these to fight.
Panna gathered with thousands of her crewmates on Cacao Island as part of Charlotte Oven's effort to ambush Monkey D. Luffy. She watched as Pekoms and Luffy exited the mirror.

elements.text: Panna means "cream" in Italian and Panna cotta is an Italian dessert, both of which follows the eating/food-themed names of the Charlotte Family and Big Mom Pirates.
↑  One Piece Manga — Vol. 89 Chapter 897, Panna makes her debut.
↑  One Piece Manga — Vol. 92 Chapter 930 (p. 8), Children of the Charlotte Family confirmed to be executives of the Big Mom Pirates
↑  One Piece Magazine Vol.4, Panna is named.
↑  One Piece Manga — Vol. 92 Chapter 930 (p. 8), Children of the Charlotte Family confirmed to be executives of the Big Mom Pirates
